alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:38AM EST until January 27 at 10:10AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek at Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Barclay Messerly Road south of the Warren Airport in Braceville floods. Knowlton Road will be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - The creek crested at 10.3 feet at 9 PM last night and fell below flood stage at 8 AM this morning. - Forecast...The creek will fall to 9.2 feet early this afternoon. Due to additional run-off from rainfall last night, the creek may again rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 9.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage late tonight to 7.6 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 745 PM EST.
